result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Must take all medications prescribed by a physician as prescribed.  No contact w/B.P., C.M. or C.L. or their residences or their places of employment excluding any pending civil actions which are as yet unresolved as needed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Victim in 15CF366 (C.L.) makes a statement.  Atty Covey states agreement in 16CF327 and 16CF383.  State agrees, as does DE and NC plea entered in 16CF327.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS in two cases.  Court notes he reviewed PSI in 15CF336 along w/other documents in these three cases.  Atty Covey notes corrections to PSI and notes concern w/one jury instruction.  B.P. makes statement.  State makes argument.  Atty Covey makes argument.  DE makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: voting rights, firearms warnings and appeal rights.

15CF366
Ct 3:  NC
Prison for 5 years (3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentence
Conditions of extended supervision:
Costs/surcharges of $518.00
Counseling/treatment per agent
Must take all medications prescribed as prescribed
DNA sample to be provided
No contact w/B.P. or C.M. or C.L. or their residences or their places of employment excluding any pending civil actions which are as yet unresolved as needed
410 days sentence credit
DE does not qualify for CIP/ERP/SAP

16CF327
Ct 1:  NC
6 months jail w/huber concurrent to sentence in 15CF366 and any other sentence
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan with Clerk of Court's Office
DNA sample to be provided
290 days credit for TIME SERVED

16CF383 
Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in

from DE to Br 1
Sentencing hearing on June 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Cover Letter from Atty. Covey to withdraw motion to withdraw plea
of Jason Wright
to withdraw plea due to ineffective assistance of counsel of Atty. Frank
Oral ruling on June 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Edward Covey in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Covey waives right for appearance today since it is only a scheduling conference.  Atty. Covey will let client know exactly what happens here today.  8/8/16 plea date.  Sentencing was set for Oct. last year.  Case has been stuck since then, getting different atty's.  Atty. Covey should be last atty. to this case appointed by PD's office.  Court also notes competency evaluation has been done.  Atty. Covey states will let Atty. Varner know what's going on also, has to talk to Atty. Varner yet.  Atty. Covey may be filing motion to withdraw plea and have a machner hearing.  Court is concerned about the statute and the deadline of after taking a plea and sentencing being done. Atty.s concur that Court has nothing to worry about on time frame.  Court would like to set a deadline for filing motion and response time.  Deadline for motion by Atty. Covey 4/28/17.  State response by 5/15/17.  Atty. Covey reply by 5/26/17.  Oral ruling scheduled for June 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Brent Wayne Varner.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Varner requests reset as DE is requesting him to file some motions he does not wish to file.  PD's office says they will appoint new counsel for DE is he withdraws.  Requests two week reset to give them time to appoint new counsel.  Court questions whether Atty Varner will withdraw in all matters.  Bond continued.  15CF366 is reset for scheduling conference.  Atty Varner to withdraw on that case only.  Will remain on the other two cases.  State notes no one showed for PTC on 16CF cases.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties states appearances.  Atty Martinez makes statement.  DE states he's had 3 different attorneys represent him in this matter.  Court questions DE re: prior counsel.  DE states he'd rather take his chances by representing himself.  Atty Martinez notes he has previously contacted the PD's office re: the chance the PD will appt new counsel but hasn't heard back.  Believes it's likely they would appoint new counsel.  State takes no position.  Court questions DE re: his ability to represent himself.  Atty Martinez provides copy of doctor's report to DE (the one that was filed late last year).  Court finds DE is competent to represent himself and allows Atty Martinez to withdraw.  Advises the application through the PD's office can continue but the Court advises DE he will not entertain much  more delay re: counsel matters.  With the DE's OK Atty Martinez will give his file to the PD's office.  Atty Martinez will go to PD's office and let them know what's going on w/the matter.  Court sets status conference.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on January 19, 2017 at 09:30 am.
from DE

Motion hearing on January 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Martinez states with the correspondence to the court from defendant atty. has to withdraw.  Court states DE is represented by atty. and has not looked at DE motions.  Court states not going to allow atty. to withdraw until competency hearing takes place.  Parties recv'd doctors report. Atty. Martinez discussed the competency report with DE.  DE would not contest the findings and believes DE is competent to proceed.  Court finds DE is competent to proceed under 971.14.  State objects to atty. Martinez withdrawing, DE is doing a pattern here. 4th counsel.  Court states DE has forfeited his right to atty. in this case. Atty. Martinez states DE believes atty. is not advocating his case right.  Court not acting on motion yet.  Court advising in the mean time Atty. Martinez talk with DE the importance of forfeiting counsel.  Court admonishes DE.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI was completed and filed on 9/14/16.  Subsequent to that Mr. Wright submitted a letter to withdraw plea and concerns of representation of Mr. Frank.  Mr. Frank filed motion to withdraw.  16CF327 Mr. Susens represents on that case.  Court addresses Mr. Wright that he understands the tremendous years and rights and what the PSI is recommending and what could be facing.  After knowing all Mr. Wright wishes Mr. Frank to withdraw.  Court grants withdrawal of atty.  15CF366 only unless withdraw of plea then the other case w/plea 16CF55 can be reopened or refiled.  State states position on 2nd letter to withdraw plea - believes need an evidientiary hearing.  Court states this does require a hearing (Mr. Wright) to show burden of proof.  Concern of substantial delay.
Cover Letter from Court Br. 1
from DE
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State states agreement as to 15CF366 - amended information filed.  DE to plead NC to Ct 3 amended to include dangerous weapon enhancer.  State would then move to dismiss/read-in counts 1 and 2 and 16CF55 in it's entirety.  PSI to be requested w/argued plea/sentencing.  Atty Frank is in agreement.  DE also agrees.  Parties discuss how the dangerous weapon enhancer would affect possible penalties.  State moves to amend information.  Atty Frank agrees.  Court grants State's motion to amend by filing second amended information.  Atty Frank enters NC plea to count 3.  Court questions DE as to NC plea to count 3.  Court advises DE re: voting rights/felony firearms warnings.  State has complied w/victim's rights statutes.  Notes stitches not mentioned in complaint/information.  Atty Frank will stipulate to factual basis.  Court accepts plea and finds DE guilty.  State will provide VIS at sentencing.  Court dismisses counts 1 and 2 of 15CF366 and 16CF55 in it's entirety.  Court orders PSI.  That to be completed not later than 9/30/2016.  Bond continues pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Frank withdrew based on PD office appointing new counsel.  After today's discussions with PD office, they will not be reappointing counsel.  Defendant was not aware of that information.  Defendant request counsel.  Court sets out 3 weeks for defendant to contact Attorney Frank.  Court rescinds order withdrawing Attorney Frank.  State does not object.  Bond continues.
